Title:
The morphological characteristics and phylogenetic analyses
indacatid a new species of Basidiodendron (Auriculariales) from southern
China
Abstract:
A wood-decaying fungal species, Basidiodendron yunnanense
sp. nov. is proposed based on a combination of morphological and
molecular evidence. Basidiodendron yunnanense is characterised by the
resupinate basidiomata with reticulate to porulose hymenial surface and
a monomitic hyphal system with generative hyphae having clamp
connections, presence of the gloeocystidia and broadly ellipsoid to
subglobose basidiospores (56.5 × 4.56 µm). Sequences of ITS gene region
was generated, and the phylogenetic analysis was performed with maximum
likelihood, maximum parsimony and Bayesian inference methods. The
phylogenetic topology of Basidiodendron based on a concatenated ITS+nLSU
dataset revealed that the new species nested in genus Basidiodendron, in
which it was sister to B. luteogriseum, and then grouped with B. alni
and B. eyrei.
